events.name: Boris Johnson comments on Putin's progress in Donbas
events.wd_label: Boris Johnson comments on Putin's progress in Donbas
events.wd_description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson commented on Russian President Vladimir Putin's slow but visible progress in the Donbas region of Eastern Ukraine, expressing concerns over the high cost to Russia.
events.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson commented on Russian President Vladimir Putin's slow but visible progress in the Donbas region of Eastern Ukraine, expressing concerns over the high cost to Russia.

events.name: Putin's progress in Donbas
events.wd_description: Johnson noted that Putin continues to make progress in Donbas, despite the high cost to himself and the Russian military.
events.description: Johnson noted that Putin continues to make progress in Donbas, despite the high cost to himself and the Russian military.

events.name: Invasion background
events.wd_description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine, launched on February 24, is termed a "special military operation" by Russia, but is considered a war of aggression by Ukraine and the West.
events.description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine, launched on February 24, is termed a "special military operation" by Russia, but is considered a war of aggression by Ukraine and the West.

events.name: Johnson's perspective on ending the conflict
events.wd_label: Johnson's perspective on ending the conflict
events.wd_description: Johnson stated that the conflict can end only if Putin acknowledges that the denazification of Ukraine has been achieved and withdraws with dignity and honor, although he clarified he does not support the premise that there were Nazis in Ukraine.
events.description: Johnson stated that the conflict can end only if Putin acknowledges that the denazification of Ukraine has been achieved and withdraws with dignity and honor, although he clarified he does not support the premise that there were Nazis in Ukraine.

events.name: China launches third aircraft carrier, June 2022
events.wd_label: China launches third aircraft carrier, June 2022
events.wd_description: China launched its third aircraft carrier, the "Fujian," the first to be wholly designed and built in the country, marking a significant advancement in its military capabilities.
events.description: China launched its third aircraft carrier, the "Fujian," the first to be wholly designed and built in the country, marking a significant advancement in its military capabilities.

events.name: Launch of the "Fujian" aircraft carrier
events.wd_description: The "Fujian," China's third and most advanced aircraft carrier, was launched at a Shanghai shipyard, featuring a catapult launcher system.
events.description: The "Fujian," China's third and most advanced aircraft carrier, was launched at a Shanghai shipyard, featuring a catapult launcher system.

events.name: Comparison with previous carriers
events.wd_description: The "Fujian" is more technically advanced than China's previous carriers, "Liaoning" and "Shandong," which use a ski-jump-style platform for launching aircraft.
events.description: The "Fujian" is more technically advanced than China's previous carriers, "Liaoning" and "Shandong," which use a ski-jump-style platform for launching aircraft.

events.name: Geopolitical implications
events.wd_description: The launch of the "Fujian" comes amid rising tensions between China and the US, with Chinese defense minister Wei Fenghe warning of potential conflict if Taiwan declares independence.
events.description: The launch of the "Fujian" comes amid rising tensions between China and the US, with Chinese defense minister Wei Fenghe warning of potential conflict if Taiwan declares independence.

events.name: Putin threatens retaliation against NATO expansion
events.wd_label: Putin threatens retaliation against NATO expansion
events.wd_description: Vladimir Putin threatened that Russia would retaliate if NATO established military facilities in Finland and Sweden after they agreed to join the US-led alliance.
events.description: Vladimir Putin threatened that Russia would retaliate if NATO established military facilities in Finland and Sweden after they agreed to join the US-led alliance.

events.name: Putin's statement
events.wd_description: At a press conference in Ashgabat, Turkmenistan, Putin stated that Finland and Sweden could join NATO if they chose, but warned that Russia would respond symmetrically if military contingents and equipment were installed there.
events.description: At a press conference in Ashgabat, Turkmenistan, Putin stated that Finland and Sweden could join NATO if they chose, but warned that Russia would respond symmetrically if military contingents and equipment were installed there.

events.name: Russia's previous warnings
events.wd_description: Russia has frequently warned Finland and Sweden against joining NATO, claiming that severe military and political repercussions would compel it to bolster its defenses in the Baltic Sea area, including deploying nuclear weapons.
events.description: Russia has frequently warned Finland and Sweden against joining NATO, claiming that severe military and political repercussions would compel it to bolster its defenses in the Baltic Sea area, including deploying nuclear weapons.

events.name: Finland and Sweden's NATO bid
events.wd_description: Finland and Sweden's push to join NATO gained traction in response to Russia’s war with Ukraine, seeking more security assurances from the alliance.
events.description: Finland and Sweden's push to join NATO gained traction in response to Russia’s war with Ukraine, seeking more security assurances from the alliance.

events.name: CATL Germany Factory Milestone
events.wd_description: CATL's first overseas factory in Thuringia, Germany, has obtained a license for cell production, marking a significant step in its global expansion.
events.description: CATL's first overseas factory in Thuringia, Germany, has obtained a license for cell production, marking a significant step in its global expansion.

events.name: License Issuance Ceremony
events.wd_description: During a celebration ceremony in the "Erfurt Crossroads" industrial area, Thuringia's ministers issued the second phase license for CATL's German factory, granting an 8GWh cell production capacity.
events.description: During a celebration ceremony in the "Erfurt Crossroads" industrial area, Thuringia's ministers issued the second phase license for CATL's German factory, granting an 8GWh cell production capacity.

events.name: Factory Overview
events.wd_description: CATL's German factory, which includes both purchased and newly built facilities, is in the equipment installation phase and aims to start production by the end of 2022.
events.description: CATL's German factory, which includes both purchased and newly built facilities, is in the equipment installation phase and aims to start production by the end of 2022.

events.name: G1 Facility
events.wd_description: The G1 facility involves assembling battery cells into modules in a purchased building.
events.description: The G1 facility involves assembling battery cells into modules in a purchased building.

events.name: G2 Facility
events.wd_description: The G2 facility, which received the cell production license, is a newly constructed building for cell production.
events.description: The G2 facility, which received the cell production license, is a newly constructed building for cell production.

events.name: Economic and Environmental Impact
events.wd_description: The factory represents one of the most significant industrial investments in Thuringia in decades, expected to create 1,500 jobs initially and a total of 2,000 jobs in the future, with part of its energy supplied by solar panels.
events.description: The factory represents one of the most significant industrial investments in Thuringia in decades, expected to create 1,500 jobs initially and a total of 2,000 jobs in the future, with part of its energy supplied by solar panels.

events.name: Job Creation
events.wd_description: The factory is expected to provide 1,500 jobs by the end of 2022 and a total of 2,000 jobs once fully operational.
events.description: The factory is expected to provide 1,500 jobs by the end of 2022 and a total of 2,000 jobs once fully operational.

events.name: Sustainable Energy Use
events.wd_description: To achieve sustainable battery production, part of the factory's energy will come from solar panels installed on the building's roof.
events.description: To achieve sustainable battery production, part of the factory's energy will come from solar panels installed on the building's roof.
